SEARCH
Package com.quantum.utils

Class Color

java.lang.Object
com.quantum.utils.Color
public class Color extends Object
Represents a color with RGBA components.

The Color class provides a way to represent and manipulate colors using red, green, blue, and alpha components. Each component is represented as a float value, where red, green, and blue values range from 0.0 to 1.0, and alpha represents the opacity with a range of 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).

This class provides constructors to initialize color objects with different levels of precision and methods to set and get the individual color components.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
RAZANAKOLONA Erwan-Matthieu Liantsoa

  • Constructor Details

    • Color

      public Color()
      Constructs a Color object with default values (black color with full opacity).

      The color is initialized to red = 0.0, green = 0.0, blue = 0.0, and alpha = 1.0.

      Since:
      1.0

    • Color

      public Color(float f)
      Constructs a Color object with equal red, green, and blue values.

      The color is initialized to red = green = blue = f and alpha = 1.0.

      Parameters:
      f - the value for red, green, and blue components
      Since:
      1.0

    • Color

      public Color(float red, float green, float blue)
      Constructs a Color object with specified red, green, and blue values.

      The color is initialized with the given red, green, and blue values, and alpha = 1.0.

      Parameters:
      red - the red component (0.0 to 1.0)
      green - the green component (0.0 to 1.0)
      blue - the blue component (0.0 to 1.0)
      Since:
      1.0

    • Color

      public Color(float red, float green, float blue, float alpha)
      Constructs a Color object with specified red, green, blue, and alpha values.

      The color is initialized with the given red, green, blue, and alpha values.

      Parameters:
      red - the red component (0.0 to 1.0)
      green - the green component (0.0 to 1.0)
      blue - the blue component (0.0 to 1.0)
      alpha - the alpha component (0.0 to 1.0)
      Since:
      1.0

  • Method Details

    • setColour

      public void setColour(float red, float green, float blue)
      Sets the color components.

      This method sets the red, green, and blue components of the color, while keeping the current alpha value.

      Parameters:
      red - the red component (0.0 to 1.0)
      green - the green component (0.0 to 1.0)
      blue - the blue component (0.0 to 1.0)
      Since:
      1.0
